channel.title: Blackberry or iPhone?
channel.description: Fuck androids. Do not like them. Need to know, buying either one of them soon.

item.title: Blackberry or iPhone?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

http://developer.android.com/guide/basics/what-is-android.html for android

and

http://www.techotopia.com/images/4/49/Iphone_os_architecture.png is about all i could find for the iOS architecture

android > iOS > palm > BB OS > win7 phone (i havent ever used a phone with symbian on it so i really dont know anything about it.)

Read full topic

item.title: Blackberry or iPhone?
item.dc:creator: @MistaBigBoss MistaBigBoss
item.description:
@MistaBigBoss wrote:

[quote=“TheCyberMan, post:12, topic:410647”]I’m for iPhones. If you’re going to get an iPhone, wait until the iPhone 5 (or 4S) comes out in October. I think Androids are kinda crappy (i.e. lag and battery drains), but it’s because they run on Java (not dissing Java). iPhones run on Objective C which is much faster There’s plenty more reasons I support the iPhone over Android, but if it’s between the iPhone and Blackberry…o.O…I don’t know why there’s a discussion about it. iPhone! XD[/quote]They do not run on Java /facepalm. Iphone does not run on Objective-C either.

The Android OS is programmed in C, C++ and the UI is programmed in Java. The iOS is mainly programmed in C, C++ and some Objective-C.

The thing is, it doesn’t matter what language it’s programmed in, because in the end the computer will not be reading C nor C++ nor Java nor Objective-C. Because it just all get’s compiled into the same bit code, machine language that humans can’t read.

If you a little bit about programming you would understand my point.
The language does not matter, what matters are the messages (the commands you give the computer).

Lagg is the result of either bad hardware or bad coding, and by that I mean bad commands, the language doesn’t matter.

Everyone just uses the language that he find the best to code with, but in the end all languages are look-alike.

Read full topic

item.title: Blackberry or iPhone?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

[quote=“Stupit, post:11, topic:410647”][quote author=MistaBigBoss link=topic=511924.msg3715111#msg3715111 date=1313590514]
Android and BB are probably to complex for your intellect to handle, so I’d go for Iphone.
[/quote]
Uhh, the reason I don’t like androids is because I’ve HAD one for the last couple years. I don’t like it and am now upgrading.[/quote]

what android phone was it? if it was a powerful(1+ghz cpu, android 2.2+, 512mb ram) phone can u explain what u didnt like about it, and if its not powerful(less than the previous mentioned specs) then that would probably be the reason ur experience wasnt enjoyable. if we knew you carrier(att or verizon) we could maybe suggest a phone.

TheCyberMan:

I’m for iPhones. If you’re going to get an iPhone, wait until the iPhone 5 (or 4S) comes out in October. I think Androids are kinda crappy (i.e. lag and battery drains), but it’s because they run on Java (not dissing Java). iPhones run on Objective C which is much faster There’s plenty more reasons I support the iPhone over Android, but if it’s between the iPhone and Blackberry…o.O…I don’t know why there’s a discussion about it. iPhone! XD

only crap android phones lag and have battery drain. my friend had his droid(the first one) last 7 days on one charge. i have personally used the nexus s in store and let me tell you there isnt any lag(also very responsive touchscreen), and if the samsung galaxy s 2 phone isnt out for sprint im considering getting the nexus s as an upgrade to my POS intercept. Ik the samsung captive has 5-point multitouch or something along those lines, and it also has a very responsive touchscreen. when it comes to about anything, you play for what u get, so if u dont spend a lot on it the chances of it being pretty good is slim.

also as i mentioned in my first post the iphone is one phone one OS, meaning they are optimized to go together, while any manufacture can whip together some phone hardware, then write some kernel modules, tweak the android OS enough to get an ok amount of performance from the OS and hardware. if you pay for a more powerful android phone, from a respected manufacturer, that has specs in the range of the iphone, then chances are that android phone is going to surpass the iphone on every level.

Read full topic

XD

item.title: Blackberry or iPhone?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

my gma has a bb bold 9650. i dont like it. if i had to use it, ok i would if that was the only choice next to not having a phone at all. i havent looked at att but on verizons site BB bold is $50 more than the iphone 4 16gb but the iphone 4 32gb is $50 more than the bb.

it probably all comes down to personal preference. do some research on both phones, go to a store and test both b4 buying one.

item.title: Blackberry or iPhone?
item.dc:creator: @xryz xryz
item.description:
@xryz wrote:

imo blackberry suck. you dont like androids its probably b/c u havent used a good phone with android. ive had 2 shit phones with android. it was shit not b/c of android it was shit b/c the overall quality of the phone was shit and couldnt handle android. the only downfall of phones with android is about any cell phone manufacture can use it on any phone they make. so if the manufacturer makes a shit phone then obviously android isnt going to work at its best. blackberry and iphone on the other hand only have one manufacture which optimize the OS to the phone hardware. I would probably say Android(nexus s, droid bionic, or any other top grade android phone) > iphone > BB. ive only used iphone in store, and my relatives ipod touches, which i liked the overall performance. my gm has a bb and i really dont like it and dont see how they ever were popular or someones preference.

Read full topic
